SEARCH
Package gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.auth.role

Interface ApiRole

public interface ApiRole
Represents a logical "role" in that a user can be assigned for purposes of using the REST APIs. Currently this role can be used to control what URL paths and HTTP methods are visible to that user, and which fields can be read or written for a given resource type.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Set<HttpMethod>
    getAccessibleMethods(String path)
    Returns the set of HttpMethods that this role grants access to for the given path, or the empty set if the role does not grant any access to this path.
    default Set<String>
    getApplicablePlanetClasses()
    Returns the set of planet classes where this role can give access.
    AccessibleFields
    getEditableFields(String resourceName, JsonSchemaDefinition resourceSchema)
    Returns the set of fields for a given resource that this role grants edit access to.
    String
    getFullyQualifiedName()
    Returns the fully-qualified name of this role
    Set<SystemPermissionType>
    getPermissions()
    Returns the set of additional named permissions attached to this role, if any
    AccessibleFields
    getVisibleFields(String resourceName, JsonSchemaDefinition resourceSchema)
    Returns the set of fields for a given resource that this role grants view access to.

  • Method Details

    • getAccessibleMethods

      Set<HttpMethod> getAccessibleMethods(String path)
      Returns the set of HttpMethods that this role grants access to for the given path, or the empty set if the role does not grant any access to this path.
      Parameters:
      path - the path that access is being requested for
      Returns:

    • getVisibleFields

      AccessibleFields getVisibleFields(String resourceName, JsonSchemaDefinition resourceSchema)
      Returns the set of fields for a given resource that this role grants view access to. The returned AccessibleFields can contain the "*" wildcard if the role should grant view access to all fields, or an empty set if this role does not grant any view permissions.
      Parameters:
      resourceName - the name of the resource type, such as Claim or Job
      resourceSchema - the JsonSchemaDefinition for the resource, if one exists
      Returns:
      the AccessibleFields that represents the tree of fields this role grants permission to view, if any

    • getEditableFields

      AccessibleFields getEditableFields(String resourceName, JsonSchemaDefinition resourceSchema)
      Returns the set of fields for a given resource that this role grants edit access to. The returned AccessibleFields can contain the "*" wildcard if the role should grant edit access to all fields, or an empty set if this role does not grant any edit permissions.
      Parameters:
      resourceName - the name of the resource type, such as Claim or Job
      resourceSchema - the JsonSchemaDefinition for the resource, if one exists
      Returns:
      the AccessibleFields that represents the tree of fields this role grants permission to edit, if any

    • getPermissions

      Set<SystemPermissionType> getPermissions()
      Returns the set of additional named permissions attached to this role, if any
      Returns:
      the set of additional named permissions attached to this role, if any

    • getApplicablePlanetClasses

      default Set<String> getApplicablePlanetClasses()
      Returns the set of planet classes where this role can give access. For backwards compatibility, if this is unspecified, then this role works on all planet classes
      Returns:
      the planet classes where this role can give access

    • getFullyQualifiedName

      String getFullyQualifiedName()
      Returns the fully-qualified name of this role
      Returns:
      the fully-qualified name of this role
